If I could change one historical event, I would choose to prevent the Chernobyl nuclear disaster from occurring in 1986. This event was a catastrophic accident that released radioactive materials into the environment, causing widespread contamination and significant health problems for those affected. By preventing this event, I believe I could have saved countless lives and prevented the long-term environmental damage that still affects the area today.

I would choose to change the outcome of the 1969 Apollo 11 moon landing. Instead of the lunar module Eagle landing on the moon's surface, I would have the module land on Mars instead. This would have allowed us to explore the red planet earlier and gain valuable insights into its geology, atmosphere, and potential for life. This change could have paved the way for future human missions to Mars and potentially even the establishment of a permanent human settlement.

If I could change one historical event, I would choose to prevent the sinking of the Titanic in 1912. This tragedy resulted in the loss of over 1,500 lives and had a profound impact on maritime safety regulations. By preventing the sinking of the Titanic, I believe I could have saved countless lives and prevented the loss of such an iconic and culturally significant ship.

I would choose to change the outcome of the Battle of Little Bighorn in 1876. The battle between the U.S. Army and the Lakota, Cheyenne, and Arapaho tribes resulted in a decisive victory for the Native American forces, but at great cost. By changing the outcome of this battle, I believe I could have prevented the loss of countless lives and the forced relocation of many Native American tribes from their ancestral lands.

If I could change one historical event, I would choose to prevent the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria in 1914. This event was the spark that ignited World War I, one of the deadliest conflicts in human history. By preventing the assassination, I believe I could have avoided the devastating consequences of the war, including the loss of millions of lives and the destabilization of global politics.
